encoded."}},"subscribe(uint32,address,address,bytes32,uint64,uint64)":{"details":"The block ranges use as a signal to off-chain, and are NOT enforced by the publisher. Contracts can subscribe to         events emitted from a source contract, and it will be relayed these events through the publisher. Before         the events are relayed, they are verified using the Telepathy Light Client for proof of consensus on the         source publishEvent(bytes,bytes32[],bytes32,byt.details: This function should be called for every subscriber that is subscribed to the event.

params.logIndex: The index of the event in our transaction.
params.receiptsRoot: The receipts root which contains the event.
params.receiptsRootProof: A merkle proof proving the receiptsRoot in the block header.
params.srcSlotTxSlotPack: The slot where we want to read the header from and the slot where                          the tx executed, packed as two uint64s.
params.subscription: The subscription data (sourceChainId, sourceAddress, callbackAddress, eventSig).
params.txIndexRLPEncoded: The index of our transaction inside the block RLP encoded.

subscribe(uint32,address,address,bytes32.details: The block ranges use as a signal to off-chain, and are NOT enforced by the publisher.     If events should only a certain range should be valid, the callbackAddress should do their     own validation when handling the publish.

unsubscribe(uint32,address,bytes32).details: Only the original callbackAddress contract will be able to unsubscribe.

publishEvent(bytes,bytes32[],bytes32,byt.notice: Publishes an event emit to a callback Subscriber, given an event proof.
